content: skull hat this is a warm winter hat with an inner ear band that provides the warmth of a double layer and serves to cover the floats being the skull motif the skull motif and decorative bands are a simplified version of the ones found on the we call them pirates hat please visit www helloyarn com for this free downloadable pattern yarn samples knit in patons classic merino but any worsted weight yarn works 1 ball 100g main colour and 1 ball 100g contrast colour will make two hats with reverse colour schemes gauge 18 stitches and 28 row in 4 inches needles us8 / 5mm dpn or circular needles if you prefer us6 / 4mm dpn or circular needles 5mm crochet hook and scrap yarn for provisional cast on size 22 adult for a smaller hat go down a needle size and tighten the gauge for a very much smaller hat cast on 84 stitches and work 6 repeats of the skull chart using crochet cast on or other provisional method chain 100 stitches using 4mm/us7 needles pick up the bump in the back of each crochet stitch except the first and last so that you have 98 stitches on your needles join to knit in the round being careful not to twist stitches distribute stitches on four needles 25 24 25 24 mark the first stitch of the round knit 24 rounds stockinette stitch to form the inner ear band switch to 5mm needles and purl 1 row fold row copyright gina davidson 2007 pattern revised 2017 permission is given for you to print and use this pattern for your use you may not sell this pattern nor may you sell items made from this pattern please retain this notice on printed copies resume stockinette stitch knit all rounds and follow chart the chart is repeated 7 times around the circumference of the hat row 25 is the joining round you will fold the hat band to the inside along the purl row and knit the cast on edge along with the live stitch around this row a knitted join like this will be flexible and secure for the life of the hat remember to weave in and secure any loose ends before you turn up the hem remove the crochet chain a few stitches at a time and slip the live stitches onto a 4mm dpn work in 25 stitch sections hold these stitches to the inside next to the working stitches wrong sides together knit 2 together matching stitches from the inside and outside needles make sure that you are starting with the marked stitch on the ear band and the corresponding first stitch on the hat to avoid creating bias complete the remaining chart row knit 12 rounds stockinette this will make a close fitting hat if you want more room or a slouchier fit this is the place to add some extra length start decreases on each needle repeat 4 times k1 k2tog
